person.persName: Charles Lair (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Virginia native. Son of Mathias Lair and Ann Elizabeth Rush Lair. Married to Sarah "Sallie" Anderson Lair in Harrison County, Kentucky, on August 18, 1801. Father of William Lair, Joseph Lair, Eliza Lair Redmon, Cynthia Lair Redmon, and John Lair. Resident in Harrison County in 1820. Owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1820. Resident in Harrison County in 1830. Owned eight enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1830. Resident in Harrison County in 1840. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1840. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Retired farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Harrison County at the time of his death in 1861.
